definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
suffix of a noun of locality

sentences.english: I will meet you on the right hand side of the department store.
sentences.chinese: 我將在百貨公司的右手邊與你會面。

sentences.english: It should be further along your right.
sentences.chinese: 應該在你右手邊再往前一些。

sentences.english: Have some candles at hand in case lights fuse .
sentences.chinese: 手邊準備點蠟燭，萬一保險絲燒斷了。

sentences.english: I always keep the handbook at hand.
sentences.chinese: 我總是把那本手冊放在手邊。

sentences.english: Yes, it's just over there on your right.
sentences.chinese: 是的，它就在那邊，你的右手邊。

sentences.english: It's on your left. It's next to the parking lot.
sentences.chinese: 威克牛排酒家在你的左手邊，緊挨着停車場。

sentences.english: When he writes , he always keeps a dictionary at hand.
sentences.chinese: 他寫作時，手邊總是有本辭典。

sentences.english: The tall blockhouse on the right used to be a jail for women.
sentences.chinese: 右手邊這個碉堡樣的建築據說原來是關女囚的。

sentences.english: Michaelis opened the drawer nearest his hand.
sentences.chinese: 米切里斯打開了離他手邊最近的那個抽屜。

sentences.english: and there' s a door on the right hand side marked deliveries.
sentences.chinese: 右手邊有個門，上面寫着送貨。

sentences.english: We have time machines handy everywhere in this house.
sentences.chinese: 另外我們手邊還有時空穿梭機。

sentences.english: Go one block west, turn north and it's on your left.
sentences.chinese: 往西走一條街遠，轉往北方，它就在你左手邊。

sentences.english: The vast majority of western medicine is down in this bottom left hand corner.
sentences.chinese: 大量的西藥都在置於手邊左下角。

sentences.english: Symmetrically standing on the right hand side is a huge water clock made in 1799.
sentences.chinese: 對稱的站在右手邊的是1799年製造的巨大的水鍾。

sentences.english: Down the left-hand side you'll see a set of check boxes.
sentences.chinese: 沿着左手邊你會看到一個複選框集。

sentences.english: Go east and go all the way along Changan Avenue. The World Trade Center is on your left.
sentences.chinese: 往東沿着長安街走到頭，世貿就在你的左手邊。

definition: easily/without trouble/while one is at it/in passing/handy
(of alcohol) to go to one's head/(old) (of a bride-to-be) to bind one's hair into a bun/(of a prostitute) to receive a patron for the first time
above/on top of/on the surface of
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
one side/either side/on the one hand/on the other hand/doing while
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
